page.title: 08FARMING AROUND KEMPSFORD
page.content: The farming is predominantly arable although there are also dairy farms. There are no sheep. Close to the three villages there tend to be meadows for dairy cows where farms specialise in milk production (with silage and hay production) and also paddocks for horses (kept for riding and hunting). A survey of two square miles round {Castle Eaton}identified the fields as: 9 wheat; 11 barley; 2 maize; 1 oilseed rape; 6 seed hay; 10 grass. The cereal fields are much larger (on average) than the grass ones, as hedges have been removed to create greater acreage units for the combine harvesters to work efficiently. Around{Marston {Meysey}over 65% of fields and 75% of the land produce cereals.
